page.title: 20Weymouth Lifeboat.
page.content: On the{Nothe side of the harbour}you can often see the{Weymouth Lifeboat}at anchor.The lifeboat is the{R.N.L.B. {Tony Vandervell.}The boat cost half a million pounds.It carrys 620 gallons of fuel,enough for ten hours at sea. It can travel at just over 18 knots and has a{range of 250 miles.}The boat is a "self-righter" and can roll in four and a half seconds. The boat usually completes{about {fifty or sixty rescue missions a year. In{1984}the boat saved the lives of {twenty-seven people}and gave {assistance}to{six other vessels. Most of the lifeboat crew live and work round the harbourside.A loud rocket bang is the signal for all the crew to report to the boat. On the{Quay side}is a{room}where you can see details of{all}the{Weymouth {Lifeboats and accounts of those saved.
